alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 9:41AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Colorado, northern Wharton and southern Austin Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 940 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Columbus, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Eagle Lake, Sheridan, Altair, Garwood and Rock Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
